you.name: Benjamin Franklin
you.description: Polymath, inventor, diplomat, and founding father

superpowers.name: Technical Skills
superpowers.notes: Scientific inquiry and experimental methodology. Writing and persuasive communication. Innovation and practical problem solving

superpowers.name: Business Skills
superpowers.notes: Diplomatic negotiation and international relations. Publishing and printing industry expertise

superpowers.name: Organization Skills
superpowers.notes: Networking and relationship building. Public speaking and debate. Coalition building

mentees.name: William Temple Franklin
mentees.notes: My grandson who I'm training in diplomacy and scientific inquiry. He serves as my secretary in Paris.
mentees.whatYouTeach: Diplomatic protocol, scientific methodology, and the art of negotiation
mentees.whatYouLearn: Fresh perspectives on younger generation's views and modern European fashion

mentees.name: Francis Hopkinson
mentees.notes: A talented young polymath who seeks my guidance on balancing artistic and scientific pursuits.
mentees.whatYouTeach: Scientific experimentation, political philosophy, and how to influence through writing
mentees.whatYouLearn: Musical composition techniques and the role of arts in political movements

goals.description: Complete negotiations with France for military alliance against Britain
Establish postal system improvements and expand printing business partnerships across colonies
Help draft and ratify a new constitution for the United States that balances federal and state powers

mentors.name: Cotton Mather
mentors.whatToLearn: Moral philosophy, scientific methodology, and the integration of faith with empirical inquiry
mentors.whatTheyGet: Fresh perspectives on natural philosophy and access to my experimental observations
mentors.notes: Strong - met through Boston intellectual circles. Though we disagree on some religious matters, his scientific curiosity and systematic approach to learning greatly influenced my early intellectual development Meeting pattern: Monthly correspondence and occasional meetings

mentors.name: Peter Collinson
mentors.whatToLearn: European scientific developments, botanical knowledge, and international scholarly networks
mentors.whatTheyGet: Reports on American electrical experiments and natural observations from the colonies
mentors.notes: Strong - longtime correspondent and patron. He introduced me to the Royal Society and provided crucial scientific instruments for my electrical experiments Meeting pattern: Regular letters every 2-3 weeks

coaches.name: Josiah Franklin
coaches.whatToLearn: Practical business management, ethical trade practices, and financial discipline
coaches.whatTheyGet: Ideas for business innovation and updates on printing industry developments
coaches.notes: Strong - family relationship. Though he wanted me to be a candle maker, his lessons on hard work and honest dealing shaped my business philosophy Meeting pattern: Weekly family dinners and business discussions

coaches.name: James Logan
coaches.whatToLearn: Classical languages, formal logic, and governmental administration
coaches.whatTheyGet: Practical insights on colonial affairs and printing services for government documents
coaches.notes: Moderate - professional relationship through Pennsylvania politics. His vast library and classical education help refine my self-taught learning approach Meeting pattern: Monthly meetings during political seasons

sponsors.name: Thomas Penn
sponsors.whatToLearn: High-level colonial politics and land development strategies
sponsors.whatTheyGet: Public support for proprietary policies and access to popular opinion through my publications
sponsors.notes: Moderate - complex political relationship. Though we often disagree on taxation and representation, his support has been crucial for major civic projects Meeting pattern: Quarterly formal meetings and correspondence

sponsors.name: Lord Hillsborough
sponsors.role: British Secretary of State for Colonial Affairs
sponsors.whatToLearn: British imperial policy and European diplomatic strategies
sponsors.whatTheyGet: Intelligence on American colonial sentiment and potential compromise positions
sponsors.notes: Weak - formal diplomatic relationship. Our relationship is strained due to colonial taxation disputes, but he remains a key figure for American interests in London Meeting pattern: Bi-annual formal diplomatic meetings

connectors.name: David Hume
connectors.whatToLearn: Philosophical methodology and historical analysis techniques
connectors.whatTheyGet: American perspectives on human nature and practical applications of philosophical principles
connectors.notes: Strong - intellectual friendship. His skeptical philosophy challenges my thinking while his network includes leading European intellectuals Meeting pattern: Quarterly correspondence and annual meetings when in Edinburgh

connectors.name: Dr. John Fothergill
connectors.role: Quaker physician and botanist in London
connectors.whatToLearn: Medical advances and Quaker approaches to social reform
connectors.whatTheyGet: American botanical specimens and insights on colonial health practices
connectors.notes: Strong - scientific and political ally. His connections span both scientific societies and peace-minded political circles crucial for American negotiations Meeting pattern: Monthly meetings when in London, regular correspondence

connectors.name: Marquis de Lafayette
connectors.whatToLearn: French court etiquette and European military strategies
connectors.whatTheyGet: Strategic advice on American military capabilities and democratic ideals
connectors.notes: Strong - diplomatic and personal friendship. His enthusiasm for American liberty and connections to French nobility make him invaluable for securing French alliance Meeting pattern: Weekly meetings during Paris diplomatic mission

peers.name: John Adams
peers.whatToLearn: Legal reasoning and Massachusetts political strategies
peers.whatTheyGet: Diplomatic experience and insights on French culture and negotiation
peers.notes: Strong - collaborative working relationship. Though he sometimes finds my informal style inappropriate, our complementary skills make us an effective diplomatic team Meeting pattern: Daily interaction during joint diplomatic missions

peers.name: George Washington
peers.role: Military commander and fellow founding father
peers.whatToLearn: Military leadership and executive decision-making under pressure
peers.whatTheyGet: Political strategy advice and help with international support for the Continental Army
peers.notes: Strong - mutual respect and collaboration. His integrity and leadership complement my diplomatic skills - together we represent different but essential aspects of American leadership Meeting pattern: Monthly correspondence, quarterly face-to-face meetings

peers.name: Thomas Jefferson
peers.whatToLearn: Architectural principles and systematic approaches to legal reform
peers.whatTheyGet: Practical diplomatic experience and insights on French scientific circles
peers.notes: Strong - intellectual partnership. His idealism and philosophical depth balance my pragmatism - we often debate the proper role of government in society Meeting pattern: Weekly discussions during shared time in Paris

peers.name: Joseph Priestley
peers.whatToLearn: Chemistry advances and systematic experimental design
peers.whatTheyGet: Electrical experiment results and American scientific observations
peers.notes: Strong - scientific collaboration. Our shared commitment to experimental philosophy creates productive intellectual exchanges, though we sometimes disagree on political matters Meeting pattern: Bi-weekly correspondence with quarterly experimental sessions
